title: Bug 102436: Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB:
When creating a 'DateTime' type report parameter in BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', is entered in the 'default value' field, the invalid value is accepted. Subsequently, the report design displays the following definition:
<parameters>
  <scalarparameter name="dateParam1">
    <property name="dataType" dateTime"/>
    <property name="allowBlank" false"/>
    <property name="format" Unformatted"/>
    <property name="controlType" textbox"/>
    <expression name="defaultValue">55/66/9999</expression>
  </scalarparameter>
</parameters>
Two problems are observed:
EB: The model should have stored a 'dateTime' type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/]), which is locale-independent, to ensure portability.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string (e.g., '55/66/9999').
4. Note that the invalid value is accepted, and the report design displays the problematic parameter definition.
